okay

We are having a problem where mobile devices can't interact with the mobile subscription confirmation page, but the desktop site is fine. I believe this was a HubSpot error since the template literally only has:

```      {% module 'subscriptions_confirmation'
        path='@HubSpot/email_subscriptions_confirmation'
      %}```
In it, but HubSpot support says it's a issue on our end....has anyone experienced this before?

When you say “can’t interact with,” what specifically do you mean? Does the page load? Is the form missing from the page? Is the form there, but doesn’t respond to touch events?

Knowing a bit more will be helpful in trying to narrow down what the issue could be. :)
Hey sorry - yeah. Everything loads but nothing on the DOM is interactable.

Hmm, interesting. Typically, when I see this particular behavior, it’s the result of a 3rd-party script (usually ones with modals or pop-over banners) not fully initializing. Do you have anything built into your site that initiates modals or pop-overs? (for example: an exit intent pop-up, a help/live chat button, a payment platform)

Also, does this happen on desktop if you use your developer tools to simulate a mobile device?
Desktop works fine, but the script is a great idea. Let me look through them, and thank you for the help!
It’d be super helpful to be able to take a look directly at the page, but I’m not sure if there’s a way to share previews of system pages with people who aren’t users on your property.
I don't think there us either :( but I appreciate it :D

If you don’t have a mobile debugging workflow set up (I don’t blame you), you could check if something’s covering the page by adding a script that fires the clicked element’s DOM tree on click.

If you try to select an input see some random div or iframe, you’ll know it’s something covering the page. If it turns up with the correct element, you’ll know that a script is either disabling or preventing the default action for those elements.
Great ideas, thank you sooo much
